data.text: @NirajRaviya @RoadsOfMumbai @rajtoday @MNCDFbombay @mumbaimatterz @iAroosaAhmed @MehulThakkar_ @diptivsingh @OzarkarVallabh @_iampratip @Explorer_Yash Once MMRDA takes over this line, they must relocate food stalls wherever required, create more space to install more AFC gates at all high footfall stns & provide more free space for commuters.  @MMRDAOfficial

@DKMCooper @RoadsOfMumbai @MumMetro @rajtoday @MNCDFbombay @mumbaimatterz @iAroosaAhmed @MehulThakkar_ @diptivsingh @OzarkarVallabh @_iampratip @Explorer_Yash @myBESTBus @chaloapp @Paytm When @MumMetro was started on 8th June 2014, Plastic tokens were used which need to deposit at AFC (Automatic Fare Collection) gate otherwise one can't exit, so there was no littering! But bcoz of this Paper QR tickets, we can see littering in stn, or roads etc.

@DKMCooper @RoadsOfMumbai @MumMetro @rajtoday @MNCDFbombay @mumbaimatterz @iAroosaAhmed @MehulThakkar_ @diptivsingh @OzarkarVallabh @_iampratip @Explorer_Yash @myBESTBus @chaloapp @Paytm I am doing the same, but people who don't hv smartphone or who want to use cash (in 2022!), they purchase tickets from counter. And on counter they get Paper QR ticket instead of plastic token. People use it & throw anywhere after completing journey!!!

@MayureshTandel @RoadsOfMumbai @MumMetro @rajtoday @MNCDFbombay @mumbaimatterz @iAroosaAhmed @MehulThakkar_ @diptivsingh @OzarkarVallabh @_iampratip @Explorer_Yash @myBESTBus @chaloapp But you can get tickets from the @Paytm app.
